intro: Licania splendens, commonly known as the golden licania, is a climbing plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has elongated, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Licania splendens thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for horticultural collections.
